City Council
============

Regular Meetings
----------------

* 7 pm
* The 1st and 3rd Monday of each month
* Sanger Historical Church  
  403 N 7th Street  
  Sanger, TX 76266

Work Session Meetings
---------------------

* 6 pm (before regular meetings)
* The 1st and 3rd Monday of each month
* Sanger Historical Church  
  403 N 7th Street  
  Sanger, TX 76266

Work sessions are open to the public and citizens are encouraged to attend. Most of the discussion and deliberation takes place during the work session with formal action taking place at the regular meeting.

Agendas & Minutes
-----------------

Agendas are available prior to meetings. Minutes are available following approval.

View [Most Recent Agendas and Minutes](https://www.sangertexas.org/129/Agendas-Minutes) | View Archived [Agendas](https://lfweb.sangertexas.org/WebLink/Browse.aspx?id=181&dbid=0&repo=City-of-Sanger) and [Minutes](https://lfweb.sangertexas.org/WebLink/Browse.aspx?id=99&dbid=0&repo=City-of-Sanger)

Proclamations
-------------

The Mayor and City Council are proud to recognize special people, events, and programs that make Sanger a great place to live. Proclamations are formal declarations issued by the Mayor to honor a specific day, week, or month. We take great pride in our community and value the opportunity to honor the groups, organizations, and institutions that make Sanger a place we are proud to call home.

Requests should be submitted to the City Secretary’s Office at [citysecretary@sangertexas.org](mailto:citysecretary@sangertexas.org) with clear details, sample wording, and contact information.

You can review the policy as adopted by [Resolution 2025-15](https://lfweb.sangertexas.org/WebLink/DocView.aspx?id=120120&dbid=0&repo=City-of-Sanger). Please note, proclamations are not issued for business groundbreakings, ribbon-cuttings, or grand openings. One presentation copy is provided free; additional copies are available upon request.
